channel.title: Comments on: PHP 5.3 End of Life

item.title: By: Joseph Scott
item.dc:creator: Joseph Scott
item.description:
In reply to <a href="/2014/08/14/php-5-3-end-of-life/#comment-4246">julien51</a>.
Not sure I'd consider it death, but there are certainly times where attempts to make large jumps between versions of a language has been a struggle. I'm thinking of Perl 6, PHP 6, and Python 3 specifically.
item.content:encoded:
In reply to julien51.

Not sure I’d consider it death, but there are certainly times where attempts to make large jumps between versions of a language has been a struggle. I’m thinking of Perl 6, PHP 6, and Python 3 specifically.

item.title: By: julien51
item.dc:creator: julien51
item.description: If languages ever die, it's because of the slowness of deployment of newer versions. Discuss...
item.content:encoded: If languages ever die, it’s because of the slowness of deployment of newer versions. Discuss…
